text: Dambulla ( Dam̆bulla, Tampuḷḷai) is a town in the north of Matale District, Central Province of Sri Lanka. It is the second largest town in the Matale District. It is north-east of Colombo, north of Matale and north of Kandy. The city has a famous vegetable market. It was also known as Dhamballai. It was ruled by Kings like Raja Raja Chola and Rajendra Chola when they were kings in 900-1000 AD. == Dambulla Cave Temple == It is the largest cave temple in Sri Lanka. The rock is high. There are 153 Buddha statues, three statues of Sri Lankan kings and four statues of god and goddess including 2 statues of Hindu gods Vishnu and Ganesh.
